intro: Stichorkis distans, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and its ability to thrive in rocky or arid environments. It has a compact growth habit with narrow, grass-like leaves. Stichorkis distans is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
